summary: I am at the core a fun person who likes to connect with others through their ideas but also interpersonally. My non-linear thinking makes it easy for me to link disparate facts and recognize patterns. Given my high levels of empathy, I would like, moving forward, to use this brain power to see how people can work together and help them get there.

projects.title: Price One Penny: A Database of Cheap Literature, 1837-1860
projects.description:
Bibliographic database containing more than 520 works, 345 authors, and more than 60 publishers found in close to 330 libraries worldwide.

It was peer-reviewed by two experts and indexed by NINES, an organization whose Editorial Boards evaluate all resources integrated into its search engine.

projects.title: The Mysteries of the Inquisition: An Electronic Edition
projects.description:
Electronic edition of a French novel, Les Mystères de l'Inquisition (1844-1845) by V. de Féréal, and two  contemporary English translations. All three texts are presented side-by-side. By clicking on a paragraph in any of the texts, the two others align themselves to show the equivalent section in their text.

The reorganization process of the original text in the two translations, including adding and removing segments, is demonstrated in a completely novel visualization by Daniel Carter, the technical editor. It is responsible for developing the interface.

I compared each translation with the French novel paragraph by paragraph and encoded all three texts following Textual Encoding Initiative (TEI) standards. As literary editor, I also wrote the introduction and the footnotes.

Georges Dodds prepared the OCRed versions of both English translations.

The Marche 2/3 is an annual rally held in Montreal to allow elementary and high school students to demonstrate their international solidarity. It is organized by Club 2/3, Oxfam-Québec's youth branch.

Representing Club 2/3 and Oxfam-Québec at the Oxfam International Youth Parliament, a forum bringing together 400 young people from around the world. It was held in Sydney, Australia between July 5-11, 2004.

Coordinating and newsletter writing for the Réseau Interférences, a network of young people aged 18 to 30 involved in their communities who share their ideas via the e-newsletter sent twice a month. Set up by Club 2/3, Oxfam-Québec's youth branch.
